body: Sounds like #3073, closing as dup for now, and let's continue the discussion there. Also providing strace loke the original author would be useful.

This log is cleaner though, as the gclog shows us progressively requesting more memory until it just plain does run out of memory. Unclear though with that folder setup why it would ever need to much RAM
Syncthing 0.12.24 works fine with 61.4 MiB Ram at the moment. But 0.13.2 does not.

Can get a memory graph for 0.13.2?

@calmh I think the go version change is a potential culprit, no?

Both are compiled with 1.6.2 iirc.

STPERFSTATS=1 writes a log of memory usage with 250 ms granularity which may help. I have an awesome package I used to do some analysis of our previous leak at https://github.com/calmh/ev but Syncthing isn't compiled with it. I was planning to write something up about that and move Syncthing to it at some point. It neatly correlates output from for example -verbose with when allocations happened in a cool UI
But it must be something specifically weird triggering it, as we don't have higher memory usage on 0.13 _in general_ than 0.12. Rather the opposite.
Out of curiosity, what do your ignore patterns look like?

no ignore patterns set for the 2 smallest directorys. The biggest directory is user-directory with some config, temp and lock-files beeing ignored.

> `*bu_last*`
> `*ä*`
> `*ö*`
> `*ü*`
> `*ß*`
> `*temp*`
> `*Temp*`
> `*tmp*`
> `.adobe`
> `.aladin`
> `.DCOPserver*`
> `.dm`
> `.jd`
> `google-earth`
> `Trash`
> `.thumbnails`
> `Cache`
> `.cache`
> `.dvdcss`
> `cache*`
> `socket*`
> `*-socket`
> `*fontconfig`
> `*akonadi*`
> `*bundle*`
> `*thumb*`
> `RecentDocuments`
> `eclipse-5.0.0`
> `.config/syncthing`
> `Local*Folders-2`
> `.cddb`
> `.macromedia`
> `.xsession-errors*`
> `.~lock*`
> `*~`
> `albumcovers`
> `.kde4/share/apps/knemo/`
> `.macromedia/Flash_Player/macromedia.com/support/flashplayer/sys/`
> `.gwenview_importer*`
> `.viminfo`
> `.recently-used`
> `*.default/*.sqlite*`
> `.Skype`
> `.mozilla/firefox/*.default/sessionstore-backups/recovery.*`
> `.mozilla/firefox/*.default/extensions`
> `.kde4/share/apps/konqueror/`
> `.kde4/share/config/konq_history`

Fascinating! Any pattern beginning with asterisk and a non-ascii character (i.e. `*ä...` causes the glob pattern compiler to enter an infinite loop, allocating memory in the process. Time to file a bug report on that and see if we can fix it ourselves in the meantime. :)

Reopen as the stack trace in the other ticket doesn't match this.

rename.to: Ignore patterns with non-ASCII characters causes out of memory crash

body: Unfortunately not super trivial to fix from our side. I understand the problem, but not the code base well enough to see the cleanest solution.
0.13 series works at the machine without non-ASCII charackters as ignore pattern.
